feed.title: SAP Community - SD (Sales and Distribution)
feed.subtitle: SD (Sales and Distribution) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: I want to see the relevant Billing documents for a sales order in Sales Volume Flexible analysis app
entry.content:
When I tried to query the sales volume Flexible Analysis app  based on a sales document number I am expecting all the relevant billing documents (Credit memo or debit memo) to be shown in the report, so that I can analyze the costs and profit margins and sale volume. But, report is showing sales order data, Delivery and it's billing document data. 

Could you please help me how can I achieve my requirement.
App Name: Sales Volume - Flexible Analysis
App ID: F1250

entry.title: Resourse Related Billing and WBS elements
entry.content:
Hello

We have the below scenario. 

Our heartquart receives an invocie for IT costs. It is posted using a generic cost center. Then we allocate the costs to WBS elements which each of them represents our subsidiaries. 
Then we want to create a sales order and assing the respective WBS element in order to use the resource related billing functionality.
We will use DP90 or DP91 to create the demo memo and then VF01 for issuing the invoice.
The problem is in customizing. 
We don't know how to link the WBS elements and the posted values to SD area and proceed with the next steps.
Could you please guide us regarding the customizing?

Thank you

entry.title: Guidance: creating 4 separate pricing procedures for OR/RE/CR/DR (learning)
entry.content:
My mentor asked me to build four separate pricing procedures for OR (standard sale), RE (return), CR (credit memo request), DR (debit memo request). Could you please advise:

  1. How to set up these four procedures end-to-end in a simple, standard way?

  2. Which parts should be shared across all, and which should be separate per procedure?

  3. How to set Document Pricing Procedure (DPP) per sales order type and map OVKK so each order uses the correct procedure?

  4. For RE (returns): which conditions do you usually keep vs. drop, and how to handle signs and tax correctly?

  5. For CR/DR: what’s the minimal set of conditions that still posts correctly to FI?

  6. In Copy Control with references, which Pricing Type  do you recommend for RE/CR/DR, and when?

Thanks! This is a learning sandbox, so any concise tips or references are much appreciated.

entry.title: Automatic creation of PR for components when production order is created
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m working on a Make-to-Order (MTO) process in SAP S/4HANA where a production order is created automatically at the moment of sales order creation.

Here’s the current setup and behavior:

  • The finished good (FG) is set to Individual/Collective indicator = 1 (Individual requirements).

  • A production order is created automatically when the sales order is saved.

  • The BOM components have item category “L” (stock item) and procurement type “F” (external procurement).

  • At production order creation, the system generates reservations for these components.

  • When I run MRP, the system correctly creates purchase requisitions for those reservations, and each PR is account-assigned to the sales order (special stock “E”).

Is there a way through standard configuration to trigger automatic PR creation for stock components linked to a sales order (special stock “E”) at the time of production order creation, without running MRP?

#PP  #MRP  #MakeToOrder  #PurchaseRequisition

entry.title: Invoice Print Type - IDOC vs Form (Fragmented Forms)
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

I'm looking for some inspiration and war stories from you talented people.
Are we the only ones struggeling with the Print Type settings in the pricing procedure when controlling output in the our Adobe Forms as well as INVOIC IDOC?

Background: In our pricing procedure we're using Print Type to control both line item pricing display on the form as well as determine value in IDOC Segment E1EDP26 (INVOIC02). Business wants these two outpu to differ in certain countries - E.g. Form to show a set of pricing, while IDOC typically containing more.

We have tried: Changing the content of the form directly, supressing values from the Print Type setting, leaving a mismatch between Print Type and actual print. However, using the same form across multiple countries, following method significantly increases complexity.

Have any of you successfully managed to separate the Print Type setting for the form content from IDOC content? Any advice on how to implement the split?

Appreciate you time,
Best regards,
Aske

SAP S/4HANA SD (Sales and Distribution)

entry.title: Update new pricing after changing pricing condition record
entry.content:
Hello all,

Currently I am facing an issue that, I do an enhancement in USEREXIT_XKOMV_BEWERTEN_END to insert a new pricing condition into XKOMV table.
The copy works fine, however, from user expectation, some of the value should be updated. But this only happens if we access to VA02 manually, and click Update Pricing => G for specific item.
The update won't happen automatically in the background after copying.
Is there any way that I can do the update pricing = G in the USEREXIT_XKOMV_BEWERTEN_END?

Thank you for your time!

entry.title: Problem related to create Sales Representative
entry.content:
Dear experts. i have an issue when creating new Sales Representative using tcode VPE1.

 Im using setting like image i post here. 

after that i input the field like usual and  click "save" button to save data. But the system not generate anything, no personnel number nor error message. it just stuck in that screen.

for info, i'm using internal number. Any suggestion what i'm missing or any configuration i miss? why VPE1 not prompting to save data?

entry.title: Incorrect Invoice Header Data Copied from Another Document During Collective Billing VF04
entry.content:
Description:

We are encountering an issue in SAP S/4HANA during collective billing (transaction VF04) where the invoice header data (table VBRK) appears to be incorrect for certain invoices.

Specifically:

The VBRK-NETWR (invoice header net value) does not match the sum of the item-level net values (VBRP-NETWR).

The header fields, such as VBRK-KUNAG (sold-to party) and VBRK-KUNRG (payer), seem to have been copied from another invoice processed in the same collective billing run.

This issue also results in the accounting document being posted to the wrong customer, since the customer data in VBRK is incorrect.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue during collective billing via VF04?

Could this be due to a data inconsistency, incorrect buffering, or possibly a custom routine/BADI or user exit involved in the billing creation process?

Any insights or recommendations for identifying the root cause would be appreciated.

entry.title: Search for the BAdI to trigger a notification after saving a sales order
entry.content:
I am looking to identify the standard BAdI in SAP S/4HANA On-Premise that allows triggering an action after saving a sales order.
My goal is to implement an automatic email notification when a sales order is blocked. I want to avoid using the old User Exits such as USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT in MV45AFZZ and instead use a modern, BAdI-based approach.

entry.title: Freight cost from outbound delivery is not transferred to invoice where there is a batch split
entry.content:
Hello Team,

During the creation of an invoice from an outbound delivery which has a batch split, the freight cost in my outbound delivery is transferred to my invoice. In my invoice, i see the amount as 25 but in the condition value amount is blank as shown below: 

I have checked the settings of the freight cost which seems fine for me, where condition class is A , calculation type is B and condition category is F. in the pricing procedure, this condition is not set as statistical condition.

In the VTFL setting, pricing type is set as G and price source E. Also copying requirement is 004 (Delv.related item) and data VBRK/VBRP is 600.

Do you know the cause of this issue?

Thanks

entry.title: Condition value of freight not transferred from outbound delivery to invoice
entry.content:
Hello SAP Team,

I am having an issue while transferring freight cost amount from an outbound delivery to an invoice. The outbound delivery has a batch split. The price of the freight is manually added to outbound delivery.

During the transfer of pricing from the outbound delivery to the invoice, I see the condition value of the freight cost as blank for the main item, but the amount is correctly copied.

While for the sub item, the net price is 0.

I have checked the settings of the item category which is Tan for the main and sub item. The billing relevance is set to H.

The settings of the freight costs are calculation type B , condition category F and condition class A.

For VTFL , the billing quantity is set to G , pricing type is G as well.

Also in the pricing procedure, this condition type has not been set to as a statistical condition.

Can anyone know the root cause of that?

Thanks

entry.title: Automatic Sales order exctraction reconize fields
entry.content:
Hi, 

I'm  trying to use FIORI APP Automatic Sales order exctraction.  All the configurations are done and I am able to upload documents.

What is not clear is how the application recognizes data and moves it into the correct field, and how we can permanently solve the wrong interpretation in order to avoid updating order by order.

Some cases : 

1) Part number 

Why product reconized correctly is not moved into "Prodcut " for pos.3, 4, 5..?

2) Qty is 0 ..why ?

In the PDF file is reconized

 

I really appreciate any help.

tks

Thanks.

entry.title: ATP in Sales Orders no longer considers QI stock with EWM
entry.content:
Hi,

We've recently moved from stock room management to EWM (embedded). 

We've noticed since moving that stock in quality inspection in the EWM warehouse is not considered in the availability when running ATP in sales orders, so is pushing out availability dates to the full lead time.

The Scope of check has not changed and I can see that it still thinks it is looking at stock in Quality Inspection, but when looking at the Availability Overview it is clear that only unrestricted stock is being considered.

When viewing MD04, the QI stock is included in the total available quantity at the top of the screen, but it does not show the QM lots as part of the MRP elements as it did previously.

Has anyone else experienced this issue when moving to EWM?

entry.title: Country of Origin for Material
entry.content:

Best regards,

Dinesh

entry.title: Any report that can show the gross value of a Invoice (before any deductions or surcharges)
entry.content:
Dear all,

My clients requirement is to have a report that can show the total price of the goods or services before any deductions for discounts or taxes are made, based on the initial price calculation of a invoice with basic details. Is there any report that can accommodate the above requirement of my client. I checked Sales volume Flexible analysis app but, it didn't work.

entry.title: FM RV_BILLING_PRINT_VIEW has not mapped billing categories B and C.
entry.content:
We have an requirement to fill  E1EDP02 qualifier [001] for rebate credit notes to support with purchase order number from ‘B1 and ‘B3’ billing types whose billing categories are B and C.

On checking further we could see the Billing Categories are hardcoded inside the FM RV_BILLING_PRINT_VIEW, they are filling the purchase document number i.e., BSTKD for document categories ‘A’ OR ‘P’ OR ‘D’ OR ‘L’ OR ‘I’.

And there is no code mentioned for Billing Category category ‘B’ and  ‘C’ to fill the purchase document number.

Our query is why Billing category B and C is not hardcoded in above standard FM RV_BILLING_PRINT_VIEW.

We have requirement to fill Purchase order number for IDOC E1EDP02 qualifier [001] for rebate credit notes B1 and B3 billing types whose billing categories B and C are not hard coded in standard FM.

Help us to know the reason why it is not mapped and how can we fulfill business requirement.
